item.title: Flora Ada x Marigolda
item.description: Marigolda and Flora Ada walked down the catwalk in the capital of Dolenjska in October as part of the 8th edition of Mestna modna revija.

item.title: PRISRČNI / enchanting LOVE STORY
item.description: Ker z mano ti si kot zarja, ki briše sledi noči. In s tabo jaz sem kot ptica, ki z vetrom leti in leti. In dan se z jutrom prebudi, ko dvoje rok te stisne v objem, slika steno oživi, tam sva jaz in ti.

item.title: Flora Ada
item.description: This summer was full of colours and patterns. Vintage textiles and second-hand clothing is where I find inspiration, which I transform into new pieces to live in today’s culture. To be worn again.

item.title: FLORA ADA
item.description: Flora Ada is a figure embraced by flowers, like a goddess of an (un)ordinary day.

item.title: A GARDEN OF FABRICS / VRTIČKANJE, PRTIČKANJE: DALJNOGLED award
item.description: In 2023, I received the DALJNOGLED 2023 award for my master’s thesis “A Garden of Fabrics/Vrtičkanje, Prtičkanje,” an honor given to young designers by the Designers Society of Slovenia.

item.title: A GARDEN OF FABRICS / VRTIČKANJE, PRTIČKANJE editorial
item.description: A Garden of Fabrics is an artistic reflection on the contrasts of our everyday lives, presented as a reconstruction of the opposition between digital and handcrafted methods.

item.title: A GARDEN OF FABRICS / VRTIČKANJE, PRTIČKANJE
item.description: “A Garden of Fabrics" is a creative project blending digital and handcrafted textile elements. Over 18 months, I explored various home textiles, focusing on their sentimental value. Inspired by a photo of my mom in a flower garden, the project connects to childhood memories and a slower-paced lifestyle, questioning if the younger generation can appreciate the same slow, quality-focused craftsmanship.

item.title: A Walk Down Memory Lane
item.description: “For it doesn’t hurt to dream when the moon watches and glows. So I am dreaming of brighter days.” — This City of Dreams from the EP “A Walk Down Memory Lane”.

item.title: A GARDEN OF FABRICS / VRTIČKANJE, PRTIČKANJE: LJFW & STYLO
item.description: October 2023 was eventful. I first presented my collection, A Garden of Fabrics, as part of the student showcase at Ljubljana Fashion Week in the ROG Center, where I received the award for the best student collection. Following that, I also participated in the STYLO fashion show for young designers in the beautiful hall of St. Francis of Assisi in Koper, where I received the second prize for my work.

item.title: A GARDEN OF FABRICS / VRTIČKANJE, PRTIČKANJE: BIEN
item.description: A Garden of Fabrics is an artistic reflection on the contrasts of our everyday lives, presented as a reconstruction of the opposition between digital and handcrafted methods.

item.title: HANDKERCHIEFS
item.description: While doing my Erasmus+ exchange program at Design School Kolding in Denmark, one of the courses I did was Design for Change, which was divided into three parts. The past, the present and the future. During the past part we acquired insights on practices and strategies prolonging garments lifetime from the past with focus on product longevity. Our assignment was to develop a design proposal within the concept of up-cycling / maintenance of second hand.

item.title: Jadwiga and the handkerchief story
item.description: This is a short story about happy coincidences, or maybe it was destined to happen?

item.title: Exhibition_Life is a Palette of Colors
item.description: ‘Hey, we should present this project in a gallery or something, whatcha think?’ was a thought outspoken on the 23rd of October, the day of the shooting. ‘Oh yeah, that would be brilliant!’

item.title: BTS_Life is a Palette of Colors
item.description: It was the last weekend in October 2021, an early Sunday morning when fog took us in, hugged us and hid us from the eyes of the bypassers on a near-by road. It was cold and the grass glittered in the morning dew. But our hearts were filled with joy and hope. It was exciting, it was something new.

item.title: LIFE IS A PALETTE OF COLORS
item.description: Watch a slow fashion film starring Špela Košir, Kresna Dara, Maja Gazvoda, Dana Rohkeus Verč, Zala Maja Ravnihar

item.title: FERTAH, ČIŽME, ČIBE, ŠKREBLNI
item.description: APRON, SHOES, CHICKENS AND DRIED APPLES

item.title: 100 DAYS OF THE SEA
item.description: It’s been a while since I painted with a brush, so I grabbed my acrylic colours and with memories of my 2nd year of BA studies and the class of Colour theories, picked up some waste cardboard and papers from the corner of my studio and just started to create.

item.title: A WALK DOWN MEMORY LANE
item.description: ‘‘A walk down memory lane’’ is a story about dreams, longing, life and transience.

item.title: I AM MORJA ZALA
item.description: I started to create under the artistic name Morja in the beginning of high school, but to be honest Morja has been in me since ever.

item.title: NANA IRGOLIČ
item.description: I met Nana over instagram around a year ago, well just about when lockdown started. And over the year we found we share many things in common besides being born on the same date. We both love flowers, bright colours and we both care for a better today and tomorrow by spreading positive small steps and encouraging people to join us.

item.title: FASHION REVOLUTION part 2
item.description: Today I’m continuing my last blog where I wrote about The Fashion Revolution movement, because I didn’t want to make that one too long. Furthermore you can read about how you can think critically of the fast fashion and the consumption of things and I also pointed out some ways how you can change your shopping habits.

item.title: FASHION REVOLUTION part 1
item.description: In today’s blog post I will present to you the Fashion Revolution movement, which centers around the anniversary of the Rana Plaza factory collapse on 24th of April, 2013. Since then Fashion Revolution Week occurs every year - this year from 19th-25th April. It’s a time when people from all over the world come together as a community, to help change and create a better fashion industry.

item.title: THE LIGHTNESS OF BEING
item.description: Story behind the photo series ‘‘The Lightness of Being’’ speaks of gifts; them being so precious that we take care of them by locking them away. Can you imagine using them and something happens to them?

item.title: LIFE IS A COLOUR PALETTE: PROLOGUE
item.description:
I am here to feel.

I am here to live.

item.title: HAPPY SCRUNCHIES
item.description: In today’s post I want to share with you some of my thoughts about textiles and how I came up with the idea of making my happy colourful scrunchies.

item.title: INTERNATIONAL WOMEN'S DAY
item.description: Today, the 8th of March marks International Women Day (IWD) and I would like to remember amazing women who influence me and with whom I worked with in the past. To thank them for being a part of the Morja community and making our world a little brighter.

item.title: MONIKA
item.description: I met Monika 4 years ago in Czech Republic at one conference and I can’t say we became connected instantly, but our friendship grew and deepened with time. She is kind and optimistic, fun and a really great co-speaker. It’s always pleasant to spend time with her.

item.title: HOW MY PATCH CAME TO BE
item.description: I call this shirt “my moody patch” and it is made out of garments I once already redesigned. But I haven’t worn them in years, so it was really time for me to transform them. Since I’m quite attached to the stories they carry, I didn’t want to part from them while at the same time felt guilty for keeping them in the closet.

item.title: REMEMBERING LAST YEAR
item.description: Hello dear reader, I’m Zala, the creator of Morja and today, with my first official blog post, I will turn the time back to March 2020, when the second chapter of my Morja journey began.

item.title: TINKARA LEDNIK
item.description: In the middle of april, Tinkara wrote to me telling me she has some old shirts they don’t wear anymore and smaller fabric pieces; she asked me to transform them into something new. And I was very happy about her request – hearing people, considering giving second chances to their old clothes, it makes my heart sing. Thank you. Remember – little things count!

item.title: MAJA GAZVODA
item.description: Maja is such a lovely, sunny person. I love talking to her about anything, she is very positive and encouraging, just gives me the boost to keep going. And not to mention - working with her is always so much fun! She really has a heart at that right spot.

item.title: ANA & PRIMOŽ
item.description: Ana is my older sister, ex-roomie and with Primož at her side as her husband; my favourite brother-in-law (I’m sorry Franci, you are awesome too) - a great role model to relationship, adventurous exploration and lifestyle.

item.title: KRESNA DARA
item.description: I met Kresna a few years ago, such a lovely human being. Catching the last summer rays, we walked down the old streets of Ljubljana to capture these moments and talk about all different topics.

item.title: DANA VERČ
item.description: On friday, thanks to lovely Kresna Dara, I met with Dana, drinking the best ginger-lemonade in Kavarna Moderna (yum! very much recomend it ) we talked about life, sustainability and shopping habits.

item.title: NANA x ZALA
item.description:
Upcycled shirts for a better and greener tomorrow.

Collection of 3 upcycled shirts made in collaboration with slovenian artist Nana Irgolič, who embroidered lovely illustrations on redesigned second hand shirts made by me.

item.title: ZLATICA
item.description: Meadow spreading down the valley. This is where I first learned to skii. Back in the year 2004, when winter was still winter and we got more snow in the lowlands. In Spring, instead of snow, buttercup flowers are shining here.

item.title: POPPY
item.description: When driving around countryside, I spot a steep hill full of poppies and fell in love with the red image. Fragile majestic flowers, dancing with the wind, gleaming in the last sunrays.

item.title: ZLATKA
item.description: I finally managed to get some more sample waste materials, and a new patch sweater was made. Sparkly, colourful. Happy happy. I love colour, I can’t imagine life without it.

item.title: SREBRNA
item.description: Everytime my mom goes for a walk, she says she has to combine comfort with convenience. And she brings home a basket of fresh mushrooms, flowers for tea, wild garlic for cream soups, etc. This time we came home with a camera full of photos.

item.title: ZALA
item.description: Beginning of the lockdown; I moved back home from Ljubljana. It was a perfect time to sort out all the material I have and as I was going through my waste-cutoffs boxes, I found some really cute stretchy cutoffs.

item.title: LIGHT OF THE PAST
item.description: Life and surroundings shape every individual in a different way, I was shaped by living in a small village, in a 6-member family. In April my parents celebrated the 30 year anniversary of their life together, and this photo series was made as a memory and as a gratitude for the family.

item.title: ŠPELA
item.description: Very often, when coming amid unknown people and learning someone is from the same area where I live, I feel connected to them by this fact, and I trust them slightly more than the others. And so happened when starting my part-time student job.

item.title: LOTI
item.description: Besides making one-of-a-kind out of second-hand and waste-textile garments, I love photography. And in the past year, when free of any university work, I decided to spare some time experimenting in the studio and outdoors. I am particullary interested in beauty-shot editorials; capturing peoples’ energy, charisma and communicating it through camera.

item.title: ELA
item.description: I love playing with light and shadow, with colour. And I love being around energic people, because their aura vibrates with your aura if you only let it.

item.title: ŠPELA BRINA
item.description: It was one day in October, the sun still shining bright and warm.

item.title: CVETKA
item.description: Cvetka represents a person who accepts the state of being unwanted, the stage of not belonging somewhere or to someone and still seeing through all of it, becoming something more. Not giving up. Blooming in its own way.

item.title: ROZALIJA
item.description: Rozalija, inspired by colorful Salvation Mountain by Leonard Knight in California Desert Area, USA and clothing details and sillhuetes of the 50s, was designed as my 3rd years’ final collection as a student of Textile and fashion design at the Faculty of Natural Science and Engineering under the mentorship of prof. Almira Sadar.

item.title: MAJA
item.description: Second hand shirts getting a new chance, a new life for a better and greener tomorrow.

item.title: ENI OD SEDMIH MILIJARD
item.description: Eni od Sedmih Milijard is a Slovenian band creating indie-folk music; bringing people together, telling stories, sharing heart-warming melodies.

item.title: IVANA KOBILCA
item.description:
IVANA KOBILCA

In 2018 the National Gallery of Slovenia marked its 100th anniversary with an exhibition of life and work of Ivana Kobilca, one of the most famous Slovenian artists of all time.

item.title: about
item.description:
AWARDS

DALJNOGLED issued by DOS, 2023

LJFW x NTF Best students collection award, 2023

item.title: Privacy policy Morja
item.description:
THE COLLECTION OF PERSONAL DATA

The personal data I collect may include your name, e-mail address, information you give me when you contact me and your navigation on my website.
